text: was a village located in Sorachi District, Sorachi Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of 2004, the village had an estimated population of 3,671 and a density of 38.05 persons per km². The total area was 96.49 km². On March 27, 2006, Kita, along with the town of Kurisawa (also from Sorachi District) was merged into the expanded city of Iwamizawa. ==External links== * Iwamizawa official website Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hokkaido
title: Kita, Hokkaido
